title: How long does recover and resitution stay on your record
question: i owe 12,000 to recover and resitution do i have to pay it are does it go to my credit and can they take any of my belonging like cess any thing and can i ask the court to lower it becaus 12,000 at 50 dollars a month will take for every.. can u help me solve this matter.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Criminal defense,Victim compensation and criminal conviction
answers: You will need to pay, unless you can get the court to change it. It will go on your credit report as a judgment. Restitution is generally based on harm that was caused to the plaintiff by the defendant. It's not likley the court will reduce the total dollar amount.
Your credit report is governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act - you are looking at about 7 years.

The debt will stay on your credit until paid in full. If it becomes delinquent than the standard rules will apply regarding how long it sits there, usually about three years. After you have made a good faith effort to pay the restitution you may petition the court to reduce the judgement amount.
